forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Rain Showers then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers between 10pm and 4am, then a chance of rain. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. South wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 7 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As evening unfolds over Downtown San Francisco, the city breathes a cool, damp air that hints at the impending rain. A gentle veil of clouds partially obscures the skyline, creating a somber yet poetic backdrop, where the flickers of city lights emerge against a darkening sky. The forecasted shower promises a touch of drama tonight, with rain expected to arrive after midnight, offering both a cleansing effect and a cozy ambiance as one nestles indoors.

Tomorrow's rain will blanket the city in a dense layer of gray, lowering temperatures and encouraging a retreat from the bluster of outdoor plans. The winds, mild but persistent, will whisk through the streets, reminding us of the season's chill. Dressing warmly is advisable; a sturdy jacket, perhaps layered over a soft sweater, would serve well against the elements. Venture out to the local café, where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee mingles with the promise of comfort, or take a leisurely stroll through the nearby parks to fully appreciate the quiet moments before the rain arrives. Yet, should the weather compel one to stay in, an evening of reading or contemplating the simple joys of life may be just as fulfilling.
